intro: Cyrtandra nitens, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas. It is known for its fragrant foliage and is often found in montane regions. Cyrtandra nitens plays an important role in the ecological systems of Hawaii, supporting various pollinators and other wildlife.
